item.title: Ubisoft Wasn’t Acquired, Says Accounting Issue Was Cause of Earnings Delay
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft’s latest earnings report is live, revealing that the company wasn’t acquired and that an accounting issue caused the earnings delay.

Earlier this week, it was revealed that Ubisoft’s H1 FY 2025-26 earnings report has been put on hold, and it will be published before trading opens on Friday, November 21. Now, that day has arrived, and we have received some exciting details from the report, including what OT really is.

Ubisoft Earnings Report Reveals Details on Tencent Deal

The new earnings report deal reveals that Tencent’s €1.16 investment in Vantage Studios should close in the coming days as all conditions precedent have been satisfied. The transaction will deleverage the group and accelerate Vantage Studios’ IP. Moreover, a cash position of €668m and the €1.16bn will significantly deleverage the group and enable it to make early repayments of the €286m Term Loan and Schuldschein loans.

Moreover, the company revealed that it has “reviewed its analysis relating to the IFRS 15 revenue recognition of a partnership in FY2024-25,” leading it to restate its FY2024-25 accounts under IAS 8. The Ubisoft report reveals that this position, applied by the group, led to a partnership signed in Q2 FY2025-26 not being recognized as IFRS 15 revenue, resulting in the company “not complying with its leverage covenant ratio under certain existing financing agreements at September 30, 2025.”

However, this will be addressed through the previously mentioned “early repayment of the Term Loan and Schuldschein
loans which have an outstanding principal amount of c.€286m.” Additionally, the restatement didn’t impact the group’s non-IFRS indicators.

For those unaware, the Chief Financial Officer at Ubisoft, Frederick Duguet, had informed staff that they were pausing Ubisoft’s stock “to limit unnecessary speculation and market volatility.” Ubisoft had requested that Euronext halt trading of its shares and bonds until the “publication of its first-half 2025-26 results.” Now that the report is finally live, players should expect trading in Ubisoft stocks to resume.

In other news, Ubisoft has stated that people are “playing fewer games,” which makes it harder for new games to stand out. Additionally, Mark Rubin has revealed that Splinter Cell was not cancelled to make XDefiant. What are your thoughts on OT details from Ubisoft’s latest earnings report? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Silent Hill 2 Remake shadowdropping for Xbox Series X/S consoles. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: ARC Raiders War—Battle of the Bunguraiders and Bungulators Explained
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders has become the staging ground for a digital gang war backed by some of the biggest content creators in the world. The feud, which has been dubbed the ‘ARC Raiders War’ or ‘The Battle of the Bunguraiders’ has taken over the social circles surrounding ARC Raiders, with creators far and wide joining forces and urging their followers to show their support by dressing a certain way.

It’s a hilarious example of how engaged the community is inside ARC Raiders, the all-new and electric extraction shooter from Embark Studios. Let’s dive into the ARC Raiders War and figure out what it all means.

When is the ARC Raiders War?

The ARC Raiders War is set to come to a head this Saturday, November 22. An immense group of streamers, featuring the likes of Myth, The Burnt Peanut, xQc, HutchMF, and Ninja, will all go live simultaneously to broadcast ‘The Final Showdown’. It will be the culmination of days of social media hype, and it’s set to take place on Spaceport.

If you want to watch the ARC Raiders War, you’ll need to be around and tuning into your favorite streamers at:

  • 5 pm PT
  • 7 pm CT
  • 8 pm ET
  • 1 am GMT

How Did The ARC Raiders Bungulators War Begin?

During a recent stream, HutchMF was brutally downed and executed (read: knocked out) in ARC Raiders. He was pleading for mercy and went down screaming, vying for war against The Burnt Peanut after being taunted with the phrase ‘For the Bungulators’.

Hutch declared war on social media, and The Burnt Peanut quickly reciprocated. Before long, all manner of streamers were pulled into the fight, forming some sizeable teams:

Team Burnt Peanut (The Bungulators):

  • Myth
  • Summit1g
  • Cloakzy
  • RNGingy
  • Shroud
  • Ninja

Team HutchMF:

  • TimTheTatman
  • Nadeshot
  • Symfuhny
  • NICKMERCS

It’s quite possibly one of the most loaded community-backed roleplaying events in recent years, and it’s only growing. Even xQc has joined the story, but he’s remaining impartial and hasn’t signed up to fight for either side.

How to Join the ARC Raiders War

If you want to represent your chosen faction in the ARC Raiders war, you can do so by equipping the following gear:

The Bungulators:

  • Striker Skin: Red
  • Bag: On
  • Gas Mask: On
  • Helmet: On
  • Padding: On

The FMF (Hutch):

  • Torpedo Skin: Red
  • Helmet: Off
  • Goggles: On
  • Mask: Off
  • Sleeves: Off

If you want to join xQc’s neutral faction, it’s just the Origin skin in blue.

Hutch has ‘control of the South’ of the map, while The Burnt Peanut has staked the North of the map.

This is one of the primary reasons why ARC Raiders continues to perform well, almost a month after its release. It’s a game that streamers can’t put down, pulling their audiences onto the platform.

Speranza is about to become a battlefield. Are you ready to serve in the ARC Raiders War? Let everyone know what side you’re taking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the Silent Hill 2 Remake is out now on Xbox

item.title: Silent Hill 2 Remake Out Now on Xbox Series X|S
item.content:encoded:
After many leaks, Silent Hill 2 Remake is finally confirmed for Xbox Series X|S. Furthermore, it’s already out to play and at half price.

Released in 2024, Silent Hill 2 Remake was a collaboration between Konami and Bloober Team to bring the 2001 horror classic to new consoles. Following James Sutherland, you’ll enter the fog-riddled town of Silent Hill to find your once-thought-dead wife. The psychologically twisted narrative was a hit then and even more so now, winning multiple awards and receiving praise from fans and newcomers alike. However, the game only came out for PlayStation 5 and Steam. Rumors and even a storefront leak hinted that the remake would come to Xbox and, now, we can confirm it’s on its way and sooner than you’d think.

Silent Hill 2 Remake is Now Available on Xbox Series X|S

Xbox Store has officially listed Silent Hill 2 Remake, confirming that it is on Xbox Series X|S. No trailer or anything has come out yet, making this a pretty huge shadow drop. Even more so, it’s appears that the game is out in full and can be bought right now. It’s Standard Edition is priced at $69.99, but is actually half off at $34.99. The game can also be bundled with Silent Hill f for $79.99.

As for DLC, we still don’t have a confirmation for Born from a Wish. Fans have been asking for it for quite a while, but no luck so far. Hopefully, with the game on Xbox, Bloober Team may revisit Silent Hill 2 and give Maria the content she deserves. The team is already working on Silent Hill 1 remake, so perhaps it would bide players over until we return to that foggy town.

What do you think of Silent Hill 2 Remake going to Xbox? Going to pick it up? Have you played the remake yet? Original? Is it as good as critics say? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Silent Hill, check out our articles on Silent Hill f’s sales and the trailer for Return to Silent Hill. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Tales 30th Anniversary Illustration Hints at Next Remaster
item.content:encoded:
A celebratory illustration for the Tales series’ 30th anniversary may have spoiled the next remaster. Even more so, it’s a title many fans have been vocal about since the Remaster project was announced.

Since 1995, the Tales series (also known as Tales of Series) has been charming players with vibrant adventures and grand action RPG combat. While not as mainstream as Final Fantasy or Persona, the Bandai Namco franchise has had a few successes in the West with Tales of Symphonia and Vesperia. Since 2021, with Tales of Arise, the series has been remastering past games like Xillia and, announced this week, Berseria. The full lineup hasn’t been revealed, but a new illustration from Ufotable may have let the cat out of the bag early.

Tales of the Abyss Remastered Possibly in Development, Hints Anniversary Illustration

In the post, seen above, the Tales series commemorates its 30th anniversary. The illustration, done by Ufotable (Demon Slayer), showcases all the recent Tales titles like Arise, Xillia Remastered, Graces f Remastered, and Berseria Remastered. However, one character there is from a game that isn’t a remaster, let alone announced: Luke from Tales of the Abyss. Given that the game came out in 2005, it being there is a bit interesting.

Tales of the Abyss was a PlayStation 2 exclusive and the eighth main title in the series. Following Luke fon Fabre, he’ll venture into the unknown to figure out his birth and escape a dangerous prophecy. Fans have been asking to see the game brought back to life for a while. It wouldn’t be too surprising if the next remaster after Berseria is Abyss, though Xillia 2 was confirmed earlier this year. Still, while it isn’t confirmation, it does give a small glimmer of hope that the PS2 title may be reborn.

What do you think of the illustration for Tales’ 30th anniversary? Do you think Tales of the Abyss is getting the remaster treatment? Any other titles you want to see redone? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more RPGs, check out our articles on the most influential and Clair Obscur’s record-breaking Game Awards nominations. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: xQc Thinks League of Legends is an ‘Unwatchable’ Esports Game
item.content:encoded:
During a recent stream, Felix ‘xQc’ Lengyel, one of the biggest streamers in the world, bagged on League of Legends esports. He stressed that the game is fine to play, but branded the esports side of things ‘f***ing unwatchable’. Instead, he backed Counter-Strike 2, suggesting that Valve’s shooter ‘clears it by a margin of like 10x or 20x’.

Once upon a time, xQc was an esports competitor himself, but those days are long gone. Do you think xQc is right about League of Legends esports?

‘That Will Probably Never Change’

In a recent stream clip, xQc was captured telling his viewers that League of Legends is, in his opinion, an awful esports game.

This was during the Esports Awards, where League of Legends secured the award for Game of the Year, beating games like Counter-Strike 2 and VALORANT to the punch. It has been a stunning year for League of Legends, with records being broken at the League of Legends World Championship event, hosted this season in China.

That’s not enough for xQc, though.

In a slight rant, xQc said on stream:

CS2 will always win: It’s a game that offers good storytelling, the spectator POV is unmatched, and it’s easy to make a story. Anyone can just jump in, and they know exactly what’s going on, and that will probably never change. It’s why it’s still so successful as a title. League of Legends?

It’s god f**king unwatchable… It’s great to play, but it’s not a great esports game… I love League, don’t get me wrong, but Jesus, as an esports game, Counter-Strike clears it by a margin of like 10x or 20x.

(Thanks to EScoreNews for the quote)

Counter-Strike hasn’t made the cut at the Esports Awards in almost a decade. The last time it clinched Game of the Year was in 2017, and since then, League of Legends, Overwatch, and VALORANT have all had their time in the limelight.

Do you think League of Legends is a bad esports game? Let the community know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Battlefield REDSEC is getting a $1 million tournament

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#894)—Clues and Answers for Friday, November 21
item.content:encoded:
It’s Friday, and that means that the weekend is finally here. Before you can enjoy it, you simply must complete today’s NYT Connections puzzle! Fortunately, I’ve got the hints and solutions you need to get things wrapped up as quickly as possible. If you’re stumped by today’s puzzle, simply read on for the top NYT Connections hints.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (November 21)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #894:

  • RACECAR
  • LAPEL PIN
  • SCREWDRIVER
  • WOLF EEL
  • BOLT CUTTER
  • GREYHOUND
  • SCARF RING
  • GRUMPY OLD MAN
  • COSMOPOLITAN
  • LAVALIER
  • CLOWNFISH
  • AWARENESS RIBBON
  • TALKING DOLL
  • CHOW MEIN
  • BOUTONNIÈRE
  • SEA BREEZE

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Think of what politicians, prom dates, or awareness campaigns might wear.
  • Green – Names evoke breezes, colors, or canine companions.
  • Blue – They’re the heart of beloved family films.
  • Purple – Each begins with a word that means to devour.

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 21:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 21 (#894)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – AWARENESS RIBBON, BOUTONNIÈRE, LAPEL PIN, LAVALIER
  • Green – COSMOPOLITAN, GREYHOUND, SCREWDRIVER, SEA BREEZE
  • Blue – CLOWNFISH, GRUMPY OLD MAN, RACECAR, TALKING DOLL
  • Purple – BOLT CUTTER, CHOW MEIN, SCARF RING, WOLF EEL

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server
